**Settings Sync** - synchronize your VS Code settings between the desktop application and VS Code web client
**Dotfiles** - specifies scripts, shell preferences and other configurations
**Rename a Codespace** - autogenerated display name is assigned to the Codespace when its created
**Change your shell** - you can open a new terminal window with a shell of your choice, change your default shell for new terminal windows or install a new shell
**Change the machine type** - allows for using resources appropriate for the work you're doing
**Set the default editor** - available choices:
- VS Code desktop
- VS Code web
- JetBrains Gateway
- JupyterLab
**Set the default region** - personalize where your data is held
**Set the timeout** - default timeout period is 30 minutes, but this setting may be adjusted
**Configure automatic deletion** - inactive Codespaces are automatically deleted, maximum up to 30 days
